intro: Odontotrichum silphiifolium, commonly known as the silphium leaf hairplant, is a rare and delicate member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-green leaves that resemble those of the ancient plant silphium. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
